intro: Thelypodium ambiguum, commonly known as the common thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. Thelypodium ambiguum is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
